Uses of Class
commands.exceptions.ExecutionError

Packages that use ExecutionError
Package
Description
cliapp.commands.cli
 
cliapp.commands.collection
 
commands
This package contains an abstract command class and related objects for interaction with commands.

  • Uses of ExecutionError in cliapp.commands.cli

    Methods in cliapp.commands.cli that throw ExecutionError
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    ExecuteCommand.execute(RequirementsPipeline pipeline, OutputChannel output)
    Executes the command by reading the script file from a ScriptFileRequirement provided by the given RequirementsPipeline, parsing the script, and executing each line.
    void
    ExitCommand.execute(RequirementsPipeline pipeline, OutputChannel output)
    Executes the command by outputting a goodbye message and exiting the program
    void
    HelpCommand.execute(RequirementsPipeline pipeline, OutputChannel output)
    Executes the command by outputting a list of all registered commands with their descriptions and static requirements
    void
    HistoryCommand.execute(RequirementsPipeline pipeline, OutputChannel output)
    Show the list of all previously executed commands
    void
    SetFuzzyCommand.execute(RequirementsPipeline pipeline, OutputChannel output)
    Change the fuzzy search mode

    Description

    Add a human element to the collection.
    void
    AverageOfImpactSpeedCommand.execute(RequirementsPipeline pipeline, OutputChannel output)
    Calculate the average impact speed of humans in the collection.
    void
    ClearCommand.execute(RequirementsPipeline pipeline, OutputChannel output)
    Executes the ClearCommand by asking the user to confirm that they want to clear the collection, and then clearing the collection if the user confirms.
    void
    FilterByImpactSpeed.execute(RequirementsPipeline pipeline, OutputChannel output)
    Executes the FilterByImpactSpeed command by asking the user for the impact speed threshold, filtering the humans in the collection by impact speed, and outputting the filtered list of humans.

    Adds a randomly generated human to the collection and prints information about it
    void

    Executes the command to remove an element from the collection by ID.
    void

    Executes the command to remove the first element from the collection.
    void
    RemoveLastCommand.execute(RequirementsPipeline pipeline, OutputChannel output)
    Executes the command to remove the last element from the collection.
